title: Low Engagement Signals
description: Signs that a conversation participant may be disengaged or uninterested

conversation.speaker: Friend A
conversation.message: Hey, how was that concert you went to last night? I was really curious about it!

conversation.speaker: Friend B
conversation.note: Short reply signal - low token count

conversation.speaker: Friend A
conversation.message: Just fine? I was fine too when I saw them last year. The light show was what really stood out to me.
conversation.note: Mirroring technique with personal share to encourage elaboration

examples.explanation: Friend B shows low engagement with a minimal three-word response. Friend A uses mirroring of 'fine' and adds a personal detail to invite more sharing.

conversation.speaker: Person A
conversation.message: I just got back from my trip to Japan. It was incredible!
conversation.note: Opening with enthusiasm and personal share

conversation.speaker: Person B
conversation.message: That's nice. I went there in 2019.
conversation.note: Answers but asks nothing in return

conversation.speaker: Person A
conversation.message: Oh cool, what was your favorite part? I'd love to hear what stood out to you.
conversation.note: Gentle invitation to share with specific question

examples.explanation: Person B acknowledges but doesn't ask anything about Person A's experience, showing potential disengagement. Person A responds with a warm invitation to share.
